title: How to Store Rice Cakes

steps.headline: Place the rice cakes into an airtight container.
steps.description: Transfer any leftover rice cakes into a container that has a lid and can be sealed airtight. If you don’t have a container, you can also wrap your rice cakes in plastic wrap. Leaving the rice cakes exposed to air will make them crunchy and hard.

steps.headline: Put your rice cakes in the fridge for up to 3 days.
steps.description: Set your container of rice cakes in the fridge and try to eat them as soon as you can. For the best texture and flavor, eat them within 2 to 3 days and then throw them away. Rice cakes are best when they are eaten fresh.

steps.headline: Reheat your rice cakes on a stovetop over medium heat.
steps.description: Put your rice cakes in a large saucepan along with any leftover sauce you have. Keep them on medium heat until they are thoroughly warm, or about 5 minutes.Tip: You can also add soup stock or water to keep them from sticking to the pan if you don’t have any leftover sauce. Your rice cakes may get mushier when you reheat them.

steps.headline: Avoid freezing your rice cakes to preserve their flavor and texture.
steps.description: Putting your rice cakes in the freezer adds moisture to them, even if you seal them airtight. They will also have a hard time thawing out before you eat them again. Keep your rice cakes in the fridge if you’d like to store them.

steps.headline: Leave the rice cakes in their package if you got them from the store.
steps.description: Most Korean rice cakes come in vacuum-sealed packages that keep air out. If you can, leave your rice cakes in the package until you are ready to use them. If you are buying rice cakes in bulk, it’s better to buy individually wrapped ones than ones in a large package.

steps.headline: Put your rice cakes in an airtight container if they're homemade or the package is opened.
steps.description: Using an airtight container helps preserve the rice cakes so they'll be fresher longer. You can also individually package your rice cakes using plastic wrap for easier storage. Use a glass jar with a lid for tall rice cakes.

steps.headline: Keep your rice cakes in the fridge for 3 days.
steps.description: Set your rice cakes on the middle shelf of your fridge to keep them cold and try to eat them within 3 days. The sooner you eat your rice cakes, the better they will taste and feel.

steps.headline: Freeze your rice cakes to keep them for 3 months.
steps.description: If you really want to keep your rice cakes around for a long time, make sure they are sealed airtight and place them in the freezer. Thaw your rice cakes in the fridge for 1 day before you eat them and try to use them within 3 months.Tip: Freezing rice cakes works best when they have been vacuum-sealed since it keeps them airtight. Depending on the ingredients of your rice cakes, freezing them could change the texture.

steps.headline: Keep the rice cakes in their package if they are store-bought.
steps.description: If you purchased your rice cakes pre-made, don’t open them up until you are ready to eat them. Make sure their package is airtight and don’t puncture the seal as you store them. Make sure the package doesn’t have any holes in it before you store your rice cakes in your kitchen.

steps.headline: Use an airtight container to store batches of rice cakes.
steps.description: If you made puffed rice cakes or took them out of the package already, put them all together in a sealed container with a lid. Open the container to grab a rice cake out 1 at a time. You can also put them in plastic bags to keep individual servings fresh.

steps.headline: Store your rice cakes in the pantry for 1 week.
steps.description: Once puffed rice cakes are exposed to the air, they will start to harden and go stale. Keep your rice cakes in a cool, dry place, like a kitchen pantry or cabinet, for 1 week before you eat them.Tip: If your rice cake gets stale, put it in the microwave for 30 seconds to soften it up.
